newsitem.title: BULGARIA: SOCCER-SUBSTITUTE MAJOROS SCORES LATE WINNER.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SUBSTITUTE MAJOROS SCORES LATE WINNER.

text.p: Second half substitute Jozef Majoros struck in the 84th minute to give Slovakia an unexpected 1-0 win over 1994 World Cup semifinalists Bulgaria in a friendly on Tuesday.
Majoros slotted the ball past goalkeeper Zdravko Zdravkov after finding himself alone in front of goal.
The Bulgarians, looking for a good performance before their World Cup qualifier against Cyprus on April 4, rarely threatened to breach the Slovak defence.

Bulgaria - 1-Zdravko Zdravkov, 2-Radostin Kishishev, 3-Ivailo Yordanov, 4-Milen Petkov, 5-Gosho Ginchev, 6-Zlatko Yankov, 7-Emil Kostadinov, 8-Anatoli Nankov (Georgi Antonov 84), 9-Dimcho Belyakov (Georgi Ivanov 46), 10-Marian Hristov (Ivailo Andonov 46), 11-Ilijan Iliev (Georgi Bachev 80)

Slovakia - 1-Alexander Vencel, 2-Ivan Kozak, 3- Miroslav Karhan, 4-Marek Spilar, 5-Igor Balis, 6-Dusan Tittel, 7-Samuel Slovak (Peter Dzurik 84), 8-Julius Simon (Jozef Majoros 46), 9-Tibor Jancula (Stanislav Varga 89), 10-Robert Semenik (Miroslav Sovic 46), 11-Lubomir Moravcik (Vladislav Zvara 69)
